title: [Return of the ANZACS]
subject_group: Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/World War, 1914-1918 - History
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/World War, 1914-1918
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/Australia. Army. Australian and New Zealand Army Corps
abstract: Beautifully detailed footage of the Australian troops arriving in Melbourne on home leave to a joyous welcome.
description: With the ANZACs on their first home leave during the Great War, this wonderfully detailed footage captures the excitement and celebration that welcomed the troops as they sail in. Shot around September 1918, the returned soldiers are greeted by a motorcade which takes them through the streets of inner-city Melbourne, lined with cheering crowds. While the source of this film is unknown, it is suggested that due to the quality of footage and editing  it was professionally shot and intended for newsreel use.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: VoD Program; B2002446; Australian War Memorial; Active; 2011
